700134f-a.text:
East 149th Street, north side, between Cauldwell and Trinity Aves. The wooden stairway leads up the cliff to several 2-story frame houses facing on an alley called Terrace Place.
June 21, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
Not terrace place which ran between Cauldwell Ave and Eagle Ave, half way between 149th St and Westchester Ave. these steps had no name and were. Private property.They served several houses that were built atop a square block outcropping of rock, several stories high, between Cauldwell and Trinity Aves / 149 St and Westchester Ave.

700715f-b.text:
(1)
Cauldwell Avenue, east side, north from a point midway between E. 149th Street and Westchester Avenue. On the latter appears the elevated structure of the I.R.T. subway and across the cliff is Lebanon Hospital.
June 25, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view, nearer Westchester Avenue. Lebanon Hospital is at the N.E. corner of Cauldwell and Westchester Avenues.
June 25, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
An exclusive view of the S.E. corner of Cauldwell and Westchester Avenues.
June 25, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
